The highest LE values were obtained for light sources obtained fromRb
discs and 375 nm emitting LED. The LE values increased from 130 to 186 lm
ceramic thickness from 0.36 to 0.80 mm. This is associated with decreasing fraction of 375 nm LED
emission for which human eye is extremely insensitive. Similar results were observed for the light
sources obtained using 400 nm emitting LED. Here the LE values increased from 98 to 156 lm
The lower LE values, if compared to devices with 375 nmemitting LED, are obtained because a larger
fraction of LED emission remains unabsorbed. Finally, the lowest luminous e
calculated for light sources using 455 nm emitting LED. In this case the LE values were only 55 and
for devices with the thinnest and the thickest ceramic disks, respectively. This is due to

100% were synthesized by solid state reaction method at relatively low temperatures. All samples
showed bright red luminescence if excited with near-UV radiation. The most intensive emission lines
